discussion_comments.comment_body:
PHP's built-in methods throw an exception when you pass too many arguments to them.

We check the number of arguments here to ensure that we don't hit that exception if the function only accepts a single argument (as we pass the value and the key to the filter method).

We take a similar approach in the `Collection:map` and `Arr::map` functions:

https://github.com/laravel/framework/blob/0e9053da9d709c544200260cc0be5e223ea8ff93/src/Illuminate/Collections/Arr.php#L600-L610

However, I benchmarked this approach with my approach and found that using reflection was faster than allowing the exception to be thrown and the impact of using reflection is negligible.

The tests fail without this work.
